content:
• Thursday, September 22, 2011
  • PAA

    Plains All American (NYSE:PAA) moves higher in the post-trading session after its CEO says all...

    Plains All American (NYSE:PAA) moves higher in the post-trading session after its CEO says all three of its business segments continue to perform well, and the company is "meaningfully outperforming" Q3 guidance estimates. Shares +3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:42 PM
  • SIGA

    Shares of SIGA Technologies (NASDAQ:SIGA) were hammered -43% during the afternoon session today,...

    Shares of SIGA Technologies (NASDAQ:SIGA) were hammered -43% during the afternoon session today, after a Delaware court ruled in favor of PharmAthene (PIP) in a dispute involving SIGA's smallpox drug ST-246. Under the ruling, SIGA can keep the first $40M in net profit from sales of the drug, after which it must then hand over 50% of the net profits to PharmAthene for the next ten years.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:20 PM | 2 Comments
  • FINL

    Shoe retailer The Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) rises 2.7% AH after reporting FQ2 revenue of $331.5M...

    Shoe retailer The Finish Line (NASDAQ:FINL) rises 2.7% AH after reporting FQ2 revenue of $331.5M (+10% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.39, beating consensus by $9.6M and $0.01. Same-store sales rose 11% Y/Y, and 2.1M shares were repurchased during the quarter. The company's operating margin rose to 10.2% from 8.9% in the year-ago period.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM) drops 11.7% AH after warning its Q3 revenue will decline 4-6% Q/Q, below a Street...

    Cavium (CAVM) drops 11.7% AH after warning its Q3 revenue will decline 4-6% Q/Q, below a Street forecast for a 2.5% increase. The company attributes the shortfall to weaker-than-expected enterprise demand and software services revenue. Roth had downgraded Cavium on enterprise concerns in late August.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • NKE

    More on Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ1 earnings beat estimates on an 18% jump in Y/Y revenue that was...

    More on Nike (NYSE:NKE): FQ1 earnings beat estimates on an 18% jump in Y/Y revenue that was boosted by currency gains. Futures orders jumped 13% ex-forex. Gross margins declined to 44.3% of sales vs. 47% Y/Y, due to higher product costs and larger discounting. Shares +5.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • HPQ

    It's official: Leo Apotheker steps down as CEO of Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ), and the board...

    It's official: Leo Apotheker steps down as CEO of Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ), and the board names Meg Whitman to replace him. HPQ +0.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ATRC

    AtriCure (ATRC +4.8%) holds on to gains late in the day after Kaufman initiates the shares with...

    AtriCure (ATRC +4.8%) holds on to gains late in the day after Kaufman initiates the shares with a buy on valuation and a price target of $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • PCXCQ

    According to a SEC filing an insider at Patriot Coal (PCX -11.1%) bought shares this week into...

    According to a SEC filing an insider at Patriot Coal (PCX -11.1%) bought shares this week into weakness, as the coal sector (KOL -8.6%) got blown to bits on production and demand scares (I, II, III). Reflective of the carnage, shares of PCX are down 38% over the last 5 trading sessions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • THS

    TreeHouse Foods (THS +3.6%) continues to trade higher after a Morningstar analyst suggested...

    TreeHouse Foods (THS +3.6%) continues to trade higher after a Morningstar analyst suggested yesterday that the company could be a potential takeover target for ConAgra (CAG +2.2%), which is looking to build its private-label business.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • VICL

    Vical (VICL +13%) is firmer after announcing successful tests using a combination of its...

    Vical (VICL +13%) is firmer after announcing successful tests using a combination of its Allovectin immunotherapy with an anti-CTLA-4 antibody on animal tumors.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • DSW

    Footwear specialty retailer DSW (DSW -1.6%) holds up better than the overall market after being...

    Footwear specialty retailer DSW (DSW -1.6%) holds up better than the overall market after being initiated with a buy at Auriga with a price target of $55.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • NFLX

    Mark Zuckerberg uses Facebook's f8 conference to unveil a revamped profile view, and an...

    Mark Zuckerberg uses Facebook's f8 conference to unveil a revamped profile view, and an anticipated media sharing platform. He also adds that 500M of Facebook 750M+ registered users logged on to the site in a single day last week. Meanwhile, Netflix's (NFLX +0.3%) Reed Hastings is announcing a Facebook integration deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • ALT

    PharmAthene (PIP +21%) soars after a Delaware court rules that Siga Technologies (SIGA -0.4%)...

    PharmAthene (PIP +21%) soars after a Delaware court rules that Siga Technologies (SIGA -0.4%) must share profits from the sales of its smallpox drug that could total over $400M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • OWW

    Orbitz (OWW -5.4%) - along with 48% owner Travelport - rack up a legal victory against American...

    Orbitz (OWW -5.4%) - along with 48% owner Travelport - rack up a legal victory against American Airlines (AMR -2.7%) when a court ruling grants a preliminary injunction preserving the right for Ortbitz to sell AA tickets.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • CBS

    CBS may have won the Nielsen ratings war this week, but investors have bigger issues on their...

    CBS may have won the Nielsen ratings war this week, but investors have bigger issues on their mind - knocking the stock down 10% in heavy trading. Though the market isn't quite buying into it today, the old-style media firm says it will diversify revenue with retransmission and streaming deals to stay relevant.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • PG

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (PG -3.7%) are lower after Suntrust cuts it to neutral, citing...

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (PG -3.7%) are lower after Suntrust cuts it to neutral, citing the global economic slowdown, limited catalysts and constraints to its top and bottom line growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM
  • BIDU

    Chinese Internet stocks, which fell hard on Tuesday due to regulatory fears, are also among...

    Chinese Internet stocks, which fell hard on Tuesday due to regulatory fears, are also among today's biggest losers. In addition to the general sellloff in growth stocks, fears of slowing domestic growth are likely playing a role. BIDU -11.3%. SOHU -10.4%. SINA -8.2%. RENN -9.2%. YOKU -10.6%. TUDO -15.1%. PWRD -7.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • GIS

    More on General Mills (GIS +9.9%): Analysts jump on the bandwagon with a wave of price target...

    More on General Mills (GIS +9.9%): Analysts jump on the bandwagon with a wave of price target increases. Leading the pack is Longbow Research at $48, while Stifel comes in at $44 on the strength of earnings growth prospects and a reasonable forward-looking P/E ratio.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • CNX

    Coal stocks are following up yesterday's beating with another sharp decline, as improved 2011...

    Coal stocks are following up yesterday's beating with another sharp decline, as improved 2011 export guidance from Consol Energy (CNX -7.8%) and reassuring comments from CN Rail (NYSE:CNI) fail to keep shares from selling off along with other commodity names. ANR -9.2%. PCX -9.3%. BTU -7.7%. WLT -4%. ACI -6.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • GIS

    Shares of General Mills (NYSE:GIS) fresh off of a rosy FQ1 report don't let a measly 400-point...

    Shares of General Mills (NYSE:GIS) fresh off of a rosy FQ1 report don't let a measly 400-point down day get in the way, gaining a more-than-respectable 2.8%. Execs from the firm said in a CC that product innovation and global sales on major brands will help steer it through a "very difficult operating environment."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • MS

    More from Barclays: Freeman and team also cut Q3 earnings estimates for Morgan Stanley (MS...

    More from Barclays: Freeman and team also cut Q3 earnings estimates for Morgan Stanley (MS -8.1%) from  $0.43/share to $0.12. In addition to the financial market tumult is the Fed's mission to lower long rates. Banks and brokerages tend to borrow short and lend long - if Twist works, they get squeezed.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -3%) resumes trading after the stock was briefly halted over reports it was in...

    Clearwire (CLWR -3%) resumes trading after the stock was briefly halted over reports it was in talks with AT&T (NYSE:T) and Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) about 4G LTE network use. Just yesterday, Clearwire's CFO had commented that the company would consider selling some spectrum if the right opportunity presented itself.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • GS

    Barclays' Roger Freeman expects Goldman Sachs (GS -5%) to report a loss in Q3 as its investments...

    Barclays' Roger Freeman expects Goldman Sachs (GS -5%) to report a loss in Q3 as its investments lose value and trading and banking fees decline. "Nearly every line is being marked down from our prior forecasts, which were not particularly optimistic to begin with."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • HTZ

    Shares of Hertz Global (HTZ -10.5%) fall sharply on heavy volume, touching a 52-week low. Rival...

    Shares of Hertz Global (HTZ -10.5%) fall sharply on heavy volume, touching a 52-week low. Rival Avis (NASDAQ:CAR) isn't faring much better, off 6.6%, and looking for answers after backing out of a run for Dollar Thrifty (DTG -1.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • GECC

    Full Circle Capital (FULL +3.2%) bucks a weak tape after UBS raises the stock to buy on an...

    Full Circle Capital (FULL +3.2%) bucks a weak tape after UBS raises the stock to buy on an optimistic outlook for its Q1 and solid progress in stabilizing its investment portfolio.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF -5.5%) CEO Rich Handler explains his first-ever sale of shares in the company. He...

    Jefferies (JEF -5.5%) CEO Rich Handler explains his first-ever sale of shares in the company. He says the move was necessary to pay off tax debt he had racked up from the vesting of old stock options. "Being out of debt is the prudent thing for me and my family." The stock had initially plunged 10% on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • FDX

    FedEX (FDX -8.5%) is suffering its biggest one-day fall since winter 2008 after cutting its...

    FedEX (FDX -8.5%) is suffering its biggest one-day fall since winter 2008 after cutting its profit forecast as demand slows here and in Asia. "The primary driver of the reduced demand is the lower sales of electronic products," says CEO Fred Smith on the conference call. "We expect sluggish growth will continue."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (MS -7.4%) "appears to be in the midst of a quarter-end spiral and the momentum...

    Morgan Stanley (MS -7.4%) "appears to be in the midst of a quarter-end spiral and the momentum appears to be feeding on itself," says risk manager Steve Sosnick, as it hits fresh 52-week lows today and leads financials to the downside. The market is in a “shoot first and ask questions later frame of mind,” Sosnick says, and Morgan Stanley is a victim of that.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • MNTA

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +3.1%) files suit against Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -1.6%) and...

    Momenta Pharmaceuticals (MNTA +3.1%) files suit against Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -1.6%) and privately held Amphastar Pharmaceuticals. The suit alleges that Amphastar's recently approved generic equivalent to Sanofi's (SNY -3.3%) Lovenox infringes on its existing patents.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • MRK

    Shares of Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST +0.9%) get a lift with an upgrade from BofA to Buy. The...

    Shares of Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST +0.9%) get a lift with an upgrade from BofA to Buy. The drugmaker says it's working on a drug with the potential to bring in $2B in revenue by treating a tricky strain of bacteria.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • RENT

    Rentrak (NASDAQ:RENT), a provider of web-based analytics products for media companies, is up 3%...

    Rentrak (NASDAQ:RENT), a provider of web-based analytics products for media companies, is up 3% after HDNet owner Mark Cuban discloses he's upped his stake in the company 8.7% from 6.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • MTN

    Vail Resorts (MTN -8%) FQ4 beat estimates, but its losses widened as the ski resort operator...

    Vail Resorts (MTN -8%) FQ4 beat estimates, but its losses widened as the ski resort operator posted a steep drop in revenue in its real estate unit. Losses for the quarter were $53.9M, or $1.49 per share, compared with year-earlier losses of $41.9M, or $1.16 per share. Overall revenue declined 25% Y/Y to $108.7M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • FWRD

    Forward Air Corp (FWRD -9.1%) takes a hit after BofA Merrill downgrades the shares to...

    Forward Air Corp (FWRD -9.1%) takes a hit after BofA Merrill downgrades the shares to underperform and cuts its price target on a diminished macro outlook. BofA says cargo trends will likey remained constrained through the end of FY11, and has reduced estimates for a number of other air-freight carriers as well, including FedEx (FDX -9.4%) and United Parcel (UPS -2.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • RHT

    Red Hat (RHT +3.9%) is still up strongly after posting solid FQ2 results (I, II), and raising...

    Red Hat (RHT +3.9%) is still up strongly after posting solid FQ2 results (I, II), and raising its FQ3 and FY12 revenue forecasts. CEO Jim Whitehurst boasts Red Hat's Linux OS is a popular choice for cloud server deployments, and declares Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) cloud offerings to be late to the game. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • EEP

    Enbridge Energy Partners (EEP -6.7%) dips after it sells 8M class A common units in a secondary...

    Enbridge Energy Partners (EEP -6.7%) dips after it sells 8M class A common units in a secondary offering at $28.20, a 3.1% discount to yesterday's close. The company plans to use the proceeds for a number of capital expansion projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • ARBA

    Ariba (ARBA -7.7%) takes a hit after Roth Capital cuts the shares to neutral on valuation,...

    Ariba (ARBA -7.7%) takes a hit after Roth Capital cuts the shares to neutral on valuation, expressing concern that Street estimates are too high for FY12. It expects numbers to come down, and reduces its profit targets to well below consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +2.4%) is up on a down day after reporting Q2 EPS that blew past...

    Bed Bath & Beyond (BBBY +2.4%) is up on a down day after reporting Q2 EPS that blew past Street forecasts. Citi is reiterating a Buy and raising its PT to $69, while lifting its EPS estimates on expectations of higher same-store sales and stronger operating leverage. Jefferies and Oppenheimer are also raising their estimates and PTs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • DE

    Deere (DE -4.4%), Joy Global (JOYG -5.4%) and Caterpillar (CAT -5.5%) were the darlings of...

    Deere (DE -4.4%), Joy Global (JOYG -5.4%) and Caterpillar (CAT -5.5%) were the darlings of stock-pickers just a few months ago - ready to ride a wave of global corporate spending led by explosive growth in China. Now all 3 have shed 10% of their value in a week and analysts are starting to downgrade. Can large-cap manufacturers recover with the R-word getting bandied around?
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 4 Comments
  • GA

    Giant Interactive (GA -9.5%) gets slammed after Roth Capital downgrades the shares to neutral,...

    Giant Interactive (GA -9.5%) gets slammed after Roth Capital downgrades the shares to neutral, citing insider sales and its recent investment into Alibaba Group as well as other non-core businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • BRK.A

    Shares in Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A -2.1%) fall below $100K for the first time since the summer...

    Shares in Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A -2.1%) fall below $100K for the first time since the summer of 2009. Over the past 12 months, stock in the Oracle's company has underperformed the S&P 500 by 20%, but over longer periods, Berkshire is the winner.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • SCHL

    Scholastic (SCHL +4.2%) pops after its FQ1 easily beat estimates on improved margins and higher...

    Scholastic (SCHL +4.2%) pops after its FQ1 easily beat estimates on improved margins and higher sales of school products. The company announces plans to cut $15M in costs, and reaffirms its FY12 outlook for total revenue of approximately $1.9B and an EPS in the range of $1.75 to $2.10, in line with expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • MLHR

    Shares of Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR) knock out a 5.5% gain (no small feat today), after posting...

    Shares of Herman Miller (NASDAQ:MLHR) knock out a 5.5% gain (no small feat today), after posting a stellar FQ1 report yesterday. The firm's operating margins improved, as the firm looks to stay lean in a tight market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • SCS

    Shares of Steelcase (SCS -19.4%) crater after the firm misses EPS for Q2 and says its outlook...

    Shares of Steelcase (SCS -19.4%) crater after the firm misses EPS for Q2 and says its outlook for Q3 is cautious. The firm sees EPS in a range of $0.15-$0.19 vs $0.22 consensus, as restructuring costs and higher commodity prices take their toll.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • FWRD

    Forward Air (FWRD -9.2%) plunges after FedEx's (FDX -1.8%) FQ1 report sheds some light on...

    Forward Air (FWRD -9.2%) plunges after FedEx's (FDX -1.8%) FQ1 report sheds some light on weakness in air freight demand. BofA piled on with a downgrade to Underperform on shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • MSCC

    Microsemi (MSCC -4.1%) has prevailed in its efforts to acquire Zarlink Semiconductor...

    Microsemi (MSCC -4.1%) has prevailed in its efforts to acquire Zarlink Semiconductor (OTC:ZLKKF), after raising its offer price to CAD $3.98/share, 19% above a hostile bid price of CAD $3.35/share. Microsemi will pay for the $525M deal in cash, and expects it to be accretive to its FY12 EPS by $0.24-$0.26.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • SFD

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +1.8%) trades higher amid reports a boardroom shakeup will occur more...

    Smithfield Foods (SFD +1.8%) trades higher amid reports a boardroom shakeup will occur more often and as the stock sees some insider buying.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM

  • The plunge in the real - off another 4% today - is bringing calls for Brazil to intervene to...

    The plunge in the real - off another 4% today - is bringing calls for Brazil to intervene to prop up its value; this after the government has spent every day of the last year trying to weaken the currency. The real is lower by 13.5% this week, the steepest plunge since 1999 when the dollar peg was dropped, BZF -3.1%. Brazilian shares ETF EWZ -5.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • TSLA

    Baird initiates Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) at an Outperform rating with a $35 price target,...

    Baird initiates Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) at an Outperform rating with a $35 price target, saying the firm is a leading EV provider. Shares are down 1.8%, easily outperforming broad market indices.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • CYB

    More on the yuan: The dollar continues its move higher vs. the Chinese currency, breaking out...

    More on the yuan: The dollar continues its move higher vs. the Chinese currency, breaking out above its long-term downtrend, as technicians might say. Puts on the yuan ETF CYB, practically being given away a few days ago, are about to get more expensive.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) is -3.2% premarket to $6.18, within shouting distance of its...

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) is -3.2% premarket to $6.18, within shouting distance of its late-August, pre-Buffett low of $6.01. Peter Tchir doesn't think yesterday's downgrade is a huge deal, but notes at the margin, firms will be less inclined to trade with a lower-rated counterparty, and - more importantly - could cut their trade lines with the bank.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) drops 6.7% premarket after announcing a 550MW solar farm project won't...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) drops 6.7% premarket after announcing a 550MW solar farm project won't meet a deadline to receive a DOE loan guarantee. The company says it's in talks "regarding the sale and financing of the project," and that the two other projects for which loan guarantees were previously announced "remain in the DOE process."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM | 5 Comments
  • UTX

    United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) says in a CC it will halt buybacks and slash its M&A...

    United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) says in a CC it will halt buybacks and slash its M&A stockpile in order to maintain its credit rating following its blockbuster deal to buy Goodrich (NYSE:GR). Shares -4.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • GR

    Premarket gainers: GR +10%. RHT +6%. Leveraged short ETFs: TVIX +20%. EDZ +16%. BZQ +15%. ZSL...

    Premarket gainers: GR +10%. RHT +6%.. Leveraged short ETFs: TVIX +20%. EDZ +16%. BZQ +15%. ZSL +13%. SRTY +11%. TZA +11%. BGZ +10%. SPXU +9%. SQQQ +9%. TYP +8%. TWM +8%. FAZ +8%. SDS +6%. DXD +6%. QID +6%. SH +3%.
    Losers: SOL -8%. VALE -8%. RIO -8%. SVM -7%. MT -7%. PBR -6%. TS -7%. LYG -6%. MCP -7%. MPEL -7%. DRYS -6%. SLW -6%. RF -6%. AKS -6%. PCX -6%. BHP -6%. JDSU -7%. AUY -6%. FCX -6%. SDRL -6%. NYX -6%. GFI -6%. ING -6%. TEF -6%. AU -6%. ARMH -5%. TOT -6%. ALU -6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • HON

    Honeywell (NYSE:HON) reaffirms its 2011 financial guidance, slating EPS in a range of...

    Honeywell (NYSE:HON) reaffirms its 2011 financial guidance, slating EPS in a range of $0.96-$1.10 on revenue of $36.1B-$36.7B. The firm also sees free cash flow of $3.5B-$3.7B. Shares -2.2% premarket, slightly ahead of Dow futures.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • WLT

    Deutsche lowers its PT on embattled Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) to $105 from $130, still repping a...

    Deutsche lowers its PT on embattled Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) to $105 from $130, still repping a 59% upside potential for new buyers. The selloff of coal producers could be overdone says Brean Murray analyst Jeremy Sussman, as he cautions the hot Asian market may not be cooling. Shares of WLT -4.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • DFS

    Discover Financial Services (NYSE:DFS): FQ3 EPS of $1.18 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $1.79B (+3%...

    Discover Financial Services (NYSE:DFS): FQ3 EPS of $1.18 beats by $0.23. Revenue of $1.79B (+3% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Credit card delinquency rate reached a low of 2.43%, net charge-off rate declined to 3.85%. Shares -1.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • GLD

    Gold takes another leg down, the October contact -3.9% to $1,735/oz. The price remains within...

    Gold takes another leg down, the October contact -3.9% to $1,735/oz. The price remains within the range of $1,700-1,900 set over the past 2 months, and the fall thus far is no more than a blip on a longer-term chart. GLD -2.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 AM | 4 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is up 2.7% premarket after UBS upgrades the company to Neutral from Sell....

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is up 2.7% premarket after UBS upgrades the company to Neutral from Sell. UBS had originally downgraded Netflix to Sell in May 2010, when shares were trading around $100. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • KMX

    More on Carmax's (NYSE:KMX) Q2 report: Comparable store used unit sales down 2% tied to lower...

    More on Carmax's (NYSE:KMX) Q2 report: Comparable store used unit sales down 2% tied to lower consumer confidence. A sharp 8.2% decline in new vehicle sales contributed to EPS miss. Shares -7.2% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 AM
  • DS

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) prices its previously announced 22.5M share offering at $4.55, a...

    Newcastle Investment (NCT) prices its previously announced 22.5M share offering at $4.55, a level that will add $102M to the firm's coffers. Shares -3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:08 AM
  • LOGI

    Logitech (NASDAQ:LOGI) -11% in Frankfurt after issuing its third profit warning in six months....

    Logitech (NASDAQ:LOGI) -11% in Frankfurt after issuing its third profit warning in six months. LOGI now sees 2012 sales of $2.4B (vs. previous $2.5B) and operating income of $143M (vs. $185M). Incoming CEO Guerrino De Luca said this warning "will be the last," and admitted LOGI lacks "enough great products" in its pipeline.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 AM | 1 Comment
